channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Tue, 08 Oct 2024 10:10:01 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Decapitated, head left on pick-up truck': Mexican mayor murdered 6-days after assuming office
item.description: The mayor of Chilpancingo in southern Mexico was murdered just days after taking office. Alejandro Arcos was decapitated, and his head was discovered on a truck. This follows the killing of city government secretary Francisco Tapia. This violence is part of ongoing cartel-related issues in Guerrero state, where violence against politicians is rising.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: The world’ smallest Rubik’ s cube launched weighing a mere of 0.33 grams hits the market with a staggering price of Rs.4.39 lakhs
item.description: Japanese toy maker MegaHouse has created the world’s smallest Rubik’s Cube, weighing only 0.33 grams and measuring 0.19 inches per side. Made from aluminium, this tiny puzzle took nearly two years to develop and is available for pre-order at Rs. 4.39 lakhs. The cube is officially recognized by Guinness World Records.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: High-profile celebrities quietly settling with victims to avoid public naming, claims lawyer
item.description: Some A-list celebrities are settling with alleged victims to avoid being publicly named in lawsuits related to the Diddy sex assault case. Attorney Tony Buzbee represents over 120 alleged victims and plans to file more lawsuits, including cases of 25 minors. Buzbee will pursue those who witnessed the abuse but didn't intervene.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Karachi airport blast: Arrests made after explosion kills two Chinese nationals
item.description: Karachi police have identified Shah Fahad as the suicide bomber behind an attack near Jinnah International Airport, killing two Chinese nationals and injuring 17 others. The Baloch Liberation Army claimed responsibility for the bombing, aiming to disrupt Chinese interests in Balochistan. Pakistan has intensified security measures ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Islamabad.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'There was an undeniable spark': Melania reveals four qualities that drew her to Donald Trump
item.description: Melania Trump, in promoting her memoir, highlights the magnetic qualities of Donald Trump that attracted her: his confidence, charm, humor, and vision. She reminisces about their lavish 2005 wedding at Mar-a-Lago with celebrity guests. Additionally, Melania's memoir offers her perspectives on abortion and women’s rights, diverging from her husband's views.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Milton reaches category 5 status: Florida issues evacuations and races to clear Helene's wreckage
item.description: Hurricane Milton has rapidly intensified to a Category 5 storm and is poised to make landfall on Florida's west coast, particularly targeting the Tampa Bay area. With winds of 180 mph, it threatens significant storm surges and heavy rainfall. Tampa Bay faces potential historical storm surge heights, and evacuations are underway.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man taped up and robbed of $30,000 by men posing as repairmen at knifepoint
item.description: A man in Bronx was robbed at knifepoint by two individuals posing as repairmen, who restrained him with duct tape and stole a safe containing $30,000, an iPad, and a passport. The suspects, captured on surveillance images, are currently at large as authorities continue their investigation into the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Your father’s been...’: Trump recalls son’s reaction to first assassination attempt
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump detailed the first attempt on his life during a Butler rally in Pennsylvania. After being shot in the ear, Trump was immediately escorted by Secret Service to a hospital. He honored Corey Comperatore, a rally attendee who died protecting his family. Elon Musk appeared at the rally, encouraging attendees to vote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If Trump loses, I'm f*cked': Elon Musk in interview with Tucker Carlson
item.description: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, voiced his support for Donald Trump in a recent Tucker Carlson interview. Musk warned of severe personal and national consequences if Trump loses the upcoming election, touching on topics such as immigration, AI, and societal changes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's campaign adviser Corey Lewandowski was planning a coup, has been shown door
item.description: In 2016, he was fired as the campaign chief following his clash with Trump's children. In 2021, he came back to Trump fold to run a pro-Trump Super Pac and was ousted from there over unwanted sexual advances towards a female donor. His return to Trump fold again and again makes him Trump's comfort blanket. But a Trump ally described him to The Guardian as a cockroach who never dies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump fuels immigration debate with claims of 'bad genes' among undocumented murderers
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump sparked controversy by stating that undocumented immigrants who commit murder have ‘bad genes’ during an interview. He misrepresented immigration statistics to criticise Vice President Kamala Harris. His comments align with his ongoing campaign to reduce illegal immigration and have drawn significant criticism from civil rights groups.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy's A-list friends doing this to avoid being outed in public, claims lawyer
item.description: "In every single case, especially cases like this... because it's in the best interests of the victim, we attempt to resolve these matters without the filing of a public lawsuit and we've done that already with a handful of individuals, many of which you're heard of before," attorney Tony Buzbee said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Two women kicked out of Spirit Airlines flight for wearing crop tops
item.description: A woman supervisor of the crew told them that she did not have any problem with what they were wearing but only the male flight attendant had. The supervisor then offered that she would get their flights rebooked but finally that was not done and they had to take a different flight. Spirit Airlines told DailyMail.com they are in contact with Teresa and Tara and are investigating the matter. "Our Contract of Carriage, a document all Guests agree to upon making a reservation with us, includes certain clothing standards for all Guests traveling with us," the airline said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: British doctor pleads guilty to attempted murder with fake Covid vaccine
item.description: A British doctor, Thomas Kwan, pleaded guilty to attempting to murder his mother’s partner by injecting him with a fake Covid-19 vaccine containing poison. Kwan, driven by concerns over his mother’s will, disguised himself as a nurse to carry out the plot. The victim survived but suffered from a severe infection.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Inside, there were the remains of a woman': Body of American tourist found inside shark in Indonesia
item.description: A 68-year-old American tourist, Colleen Monfore, was swept away by strong currents while diving in Indonesia. Tragically, her remains were discovered inside a shark's stomach. Local authorities confirmed the discovery and are investigating to further verify the identity and circumstances surrounding the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania: What Donald Trump and Barron said about bestseller before release
item.description: Melania Trump’s memoir, which quickly became Amazon’s bestseller, highlights her love for her son Barron and addresses his bullying over false autistic claims by Rosie O'Donnell, whom she criticizes for malice. Melania’s book avoids delving into Donald Trump’s controversies and focuses more on her personal story and family commitment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: American man sentenced to nearly seven years in Russian prison for alleged mercenary activity
item.description: Stephen James Hubbard, a 72-year-old American, has been sentenced to nearly seven years in a Russian penal colony for allegedly fighting as a mercenary for Ukraine. Prosecutors claimed he was part of a defence unit in Izyum, but his sister disputes these allegations, noting his pacifist tendencies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Milton forecast to become category 5, taking aim at Florida's Gulf Coast
item.description: Hurricane Milton intensified into a Category 4 storm with 155 mph winds, aiming at Florida's Tampa Bay area. Expected to strengthen into a Category 5, it threatens significant storm surges and heavy rainfall. Evacuations and emergency preparations are underway as officials prioritize safety and debris cleanup.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Howard Stern's blackface video viral ahead of his interview with Kamala Harris
item.description: An old video of Howard Stern in blackface has resurfaced, generating controversy as Kamala Harris is set for an interview with him. This is not first time that the video has come to notice. Stern earlier addressed controversy and clarified that he was not proud of what he did. "The s**t I did was fu*king crazy," he said according to a PEOPLE article.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: List of US states where you can vote without ID in the 2024 presidential election
item.description: Debate intensifies as the 2024 US presidential election nears, with 35 states requiring voter IDs at the polls and 15 states plus Washington, D.C. allowing voting without ID. Kamala Harris highlights challenges for rural communities, while Elon Musk criticizes voting without ID.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
